poem:
Title: "In the Candlelit Court of Vanity"

In the flashbulb glare of fame,
a silver Instagram case unfolds,
the tarnished crown of a TV victor,
Scotty, veiled in authority's shadow.
Promises whispered in pixels,
a currency of illusion.
Big Brother watches, tongue tainted by finesse,
the screen shimmers with guiltless pleas,
Under the weight of an automated heart,
the verdict lurks in the ether.
